title: Kunal Kamra row: Shiva Sena functionary seeks complaint against comedian, opposition leaders including Rahul Gandhi
content: Kamra’s latest stand-up, in which he has allegedly referred to Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde as a ‘Gaddar’ (traitor), has drawn the ire of Shiv Sena party

title: Assam Congress demands breach of privilege against BJP MLA Rupjyoti Kurmi for Assembly ruckus
content: In a letter to Assam Assembly Speaker Biswajit Daimary, the Leader of Opposition, Debabrata Saikia alleged that BJP MLA Rupjyoti Kurmi ‘lunged and abused’ the opposition MLAs.

title: Amit Shah’s March-end visit postponed amid search for Bengal BJP chief
content: There are some speculations that the party may maintain the status quo and continue with Sukanta Majumdar as the president till the Assembly polls scheduled next year

title: Congress thrusted ‘emergency regime’ on Telangana in name of ‘Indiramma rajyam’, says KTR
content: BRS working president K.T. Rama Rao criticises Congress, promises justice for BRS cadres, and highlights party’s achievements

title: U.P. BJP sends show-cause notice to MLA over remarks against the State government
content: MLA Nand Kishor Gurjar alleged that Uttar Pradesh has the “most corrupt government” ever and that officers are misleading CM Yogi Adityanath and looting the exchequer

title: Heavy rush at New Delhi Railway Station but no stampede: officials
content: A source said Large crowds gathered on platforms 12 and 13 due to delays in multiple trains, including the Shiv Ganga Express and Jammu Rajdhani Express

title: Shiv Sena demands comedian Kunal Kamra’s arrest, ransack hotel over remarks on Eknath Shinde
content: The party workers vandalise a hotel where comedian’s show featuring ‘gaddar’ jibe at Deputy CM Shinde was filmed

title: Operation on to flush out a group of militants from Kathua forests
content: Kathua has seen heightened militant activity in the past one year, with several groups from Pakistan crossing into the Jammu region from the International Border

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to reach out to horticulture farmers affected by untimely rains, hailstorms
content: Crops spread over 40 villages in 10 mandals of Kadapa, Anantapur, Sri Sathya Sai and Prakasam districts damaged, officials tell the Chief Minister; he enquires about two banana farmers who attempted suicide reportedly due to crop loss

title: Nashik Kumbh Mela: State to introduce Kumbh Mela Authority Law on the lines of U.P.
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced a ₹1,100 crore plan for the development of Trimbakeshwar Temple and the establishment of a Kumbh Mela Authority Law

title: In 2013, Operation Puttur helped to crack half-a-dozen terror cases
content: The Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh Police nabbed two terror suspects at Puttur in Chittoor district on October 5, 2013. They were planning to sabotage the Brahmostavam festival at Tirumala, and confessed to planning the killing of BJP and Hindu Munnani leaders

title: How a village in north Chennai transformed into a town
content: Gummidipoondi became a town after it was made a taluk in 1972. Its development started after the SIPCOT industrial park was opened in 1983. It now employs over 15,000 persons

title: 40 announcements made in last year’s Budget implemented: Mayor
content: Key initiatives are road improvement, beautification, restoration of waterbodies, and infrastructure upgrade. Road projects are under way across the city. But the plan to buy machines to repair potholes was cancelled, says the report released by the office of R. Priya

title: Water Metro terminal at Mattancherry to receive ferries from April
content: Work on the terminal is progressing swiftly in preparation for the upcoming summer vacation, when families and visitors throng the city’s waterfront for boat rides, followed by the tourist season that begins in Kerala with Onam

title: Donation of ₹1 crore made to Anna Canteen in memory of Narne Ranga Rao
content: Andhra Pradesh Real Estate Developers founder chairman Narne Ranga Rao’s family hands over a cheque worth ₹1,00,01,016 to Chief Minster N. Chandarababu Naidu

title: School cooks to go on hunger strike at Secretariat on April 4,5
content: The  workers’ union is urging for a model similar to Tamil Nadu, where school cooks are recognised as part-time, contingent employees and provided fair wages and benefits

title: BEE calls for promoting 5 star ACs in cities like Vizag, Vijayawada and Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh
content: Five-star rated air conditioners would be of immense benefit to consumers in Visakhapatnam, which, being the State’s industrial and commercial hub, has been recording rapid energy consumption, says BEE Secretary

title: Science is the basis for every human being, says scholar
content: Jagadeeshwara Rao was delivering a keynote address at a symposium on Science and Sustainability at the Central University of Karnataka

title: Fine rice to ration card holders in Telangana from Ugadi
content: The distribution would cover 84% of Telangana population where every person in the eligible families would get 6 kg of rice every month

title: TNPDCL purchased power at a cost of ₹7,953 crore from exchanges in 2023-24
content: The corporation was a major buyer of electricity from the High Price Day Ahead Market in power exchanges, according to data shared in the report on the short-term power market in India 2023-24, released by the Central Electricity Regulatory Commission

title: Cash found at Delhi HC judge’s residence: CJI seeks details of guards at Judge Yashwant Varma’s house
content: Chief Justice of Delhi High Court forwards query to the police; judge asked not to dispose of his phones or delete or modify any conversation, message or data in them during the probe

title: Honey-trap issue: Congress president Kharge meets Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
content: Though it was termed a “courtesy visit”, Mr. Kharge and Mr. Siddaramaiah had a closed-door meeting for nearly an hour during which political developments were discussed

title: Decks cleared for first phase construction of integrated bus terminal at Karikkamuri in Ernakulam
content: Both KSRTC and private buses will operate from the proposed terminal, designed similarly to the 26-acre Vyttila Mobility Hub, where separate bus bays are allocated for them

title: 20% export duty on onion scrapped, farmers’ organisation asks for long-term policy
content: Kisan Sabha has urged the government to avoid irregular export bans and export restrictions, and to instead take steps to formulate a long-term export policy

title: ASHAs to hold mass hunger strike on March 24
content: ASHAs in Kerala are protesting for better pay and benefits, leading to mass hunger strike and political tensions

title: Notorious drug trafficker Jaggu Bhagwanpuria shifted to Central Jail in Assam
content: Jaggu Bhagwanpuria is believed to have continued to orchestrate criminal activities from within Bathinda Central Jail, reportedly using smuggled mobile phones and a loyal network of associates

title: National Consultation in Bengaluru addresses gender disparity in India’s higher judiciary
content: The event brought together retired judges, legal professionals, scholars, and civil society representatives to confront systemic barriers impeding women’s advancement in India’s judiciary, where representation remains alarmingly low

title: IPL excitement palpable in Vizag as stage is set for first match between DC and LSG on March 24
content: ACA and VDCA officials leave no stone unturned to ensure hassle-free arrangements, right from crowd management to player facilities; Governor Abdul Nazeer gives his consent to attend the event, says ACA president Sivanath

title: No calls were made to over Aaditya’s ‘role’ in Disha Salian case: Sanjay Raut
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader accuses BJP of playing politics with the dead after Narayan Rane claimed Uddhav had reached out to with him with a request to conceal his son’s involvement

title: Temple chariot tragedy: 16-year-old girl succumbs to  injuries
content: Jyothi was watching the procession sitting in an autorickshaw, when the 100-feet-high chariot headed for Madduramma temple crashed onto the vehicle

title: Chief Minister Stalin is not willing to conduct caste census: Palaniswami
content: Pointing out that the DMK govt. did not extend the tenure of the one-man commission formed to collect data on castes, communities, and tribes during the previous AIADMK regime, he alleges that the CM has shown little interest in the issue

title: If Bihar has to change, then government has to be changed, says Congress leader Pawan Khera
content: He lashes out at the Nitish Kumar-led National Democratic Alliance government of Bihar over the issues of development and law and order

title: Pilgrims from Maharashtra, Karnataka make beeline for Srisailam  ahead of Ugadi
content: It is a custom among the devotees of the two States to offer a part of their crop yield to the deities during the Ugadi festivities to be held from March 27 to 31 this year

title: ‘Thiruthu,’ a correctional film festival at Viyyur central jail from March 24
content: International Film Festival Thrissur to host five-day correctional film festival for inmates. The fete aims to promote rehabilitation and social change through the medium of cinema

title: 100-day anti-TB campaign screens 61.4 lakh persons for infection
content: 5,588 new TB cases found in State whose treatment up is being ensured; full report of the campaign will be released on March 24, World TB Day

title: NIA chargesheets four alleged Babbar Khalsa International operatives
content: Chargesheet filed in connection with a grenade attack case in Chandigarh in 2024; two of them are based in Pakistan and United States

title: Court warrant against Bidar official for not submitting report in land-grab case
content: A former gram panchayat president has accused BJP MLA Prabhu Chavan of encroaching upon government land

title: Tiruvarur-Thiruthuraipoondi-Agasthiyampalli railway line energised
content: Electrical Inspector to the Government of India accorded sanction for energisation of the broad gauge section; a test run of an electric locomotive has been conducted

title: Vizag may host ICC Women’s World Cup matches this year, says ACA president Kesineni Sivanath
content: As of now, it is speculative, and an official communication from the BCCI is awaited, he says, adding that the Port City may also be the venue for a Men’s ODI match in December

title: ‘Women are challenging the status quo in tech and reshaping the tech landscape’
content: A panel discussion titled ‘Breaking Barriers in Tech: Stories of Resilience and Innovation’ was held on Honeywell’s campus in Bengaluru

title: British-built Pallikkunnu CSI Church to be made a heritage tourism site soon
content: Tourism Minister gave directives to the State Tourism Director to prepare a heritage tourism project for the church

title: HBCH&RC experts roped in to study factors behind rise in cancer cases in Balabhadrapuram
content: Over 20 persons are suffering from various cancers in Balabhadrapuram alone, while 19 more have been reported with symptoms of various cancers during the door-to-door surveys

title: Stop destruction of RTI Act, Jairam Ramesh tells Vaishnaw
content: The Congress leader wrote to the IT Minister: “In the interests of transparency and accountability, I would urge you to pause, review and repeal Section 44 (3) of the Data Protection Act, 2023 which destroys the RTI Act, 2005”

title: Fishing community in Kerala hit by climate change, says CMFRI
content: According to the study, 72.7% of respondents cited a reduction in fish production as the most prominent issue, followed by a potential decrease in overall catch and income

title: Muslim organisations boycott Nitish Kumar’s Iftar over his support to Waqf Amendment Bill
content: The organisations, which have registered their protest include the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, Imarat-e-Sharia, Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind, Jamiat Ahle Hadith, Jamal-e-Islami Hind, Khanqah Mujibia and Khanqah Rahmani.

title: BMTC to launch mobile service vans for bus maintenance
content: The vehicles will be flagged off by Transport and Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy at the BMTC Central Office in Shanthinagar

title: CPI(M) urges Andhra Pradesh government to repeal property tax hike
content: Party’s State secretary V. Srinivasa Rao writes to Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to take necessary steps to repeal the Municipal Amendment Act 44/2020, which enables the tax calculation of a property based on its capital value instead of the rental value

title: ‘Millet Man of India’ asks farmers to avoid usage of fertilisers
content: Khadar Vali takes a dig at the policy of giving subsidies for fertilisers, and the distribution of rice through the public distribution system on the second day of the three-day Millets Mela—2025 in Anantapur

title: Government integrates urban and rural SHGs
content: The integration of urban SHGs with rural SHGs aims to bridge this gap by leveraging urban markets as distribution channels for rural SHG products; collaboration is expected to create new economic opportunities, boost rural industries and strengthen financial inclusion

title: Kerala Forest department introduces audit framework to assess wildlife mortalities
content: Wild Animal Mortality Audit Framework will involve real-time data collection and centralised digital documentation

title: 81 libraries get laptops, projectors from Ernakulam district panchayat
content: The distribution of new devices marked the first phase of an effort to equip all libraries with modern technology for public access

title: Protest in Afzalpur with body of farmer found dead
content: Agitating farmers keep the body outside the Tehsil office and block the Kalaburagi-Vijayapura State Highway for nearly four hours

title: Jokic expected back during Nuggets' homestand
content: Nikola Jokic, who has been sidelined due to left ankle impingement, plans to return "at some point" during the Nuggets' upcoming five-game homestand, coach Michael Malone said Sunday.

title: Sources: Curry joining Dubs in Miami; status TBD
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry is traveling to join the team in Miami, and his status for Tuesday's game against the Heat will depend on how his pelvic bruise responds to treatment over the next two days, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Marsch sent off during Canada win over USMNT
content: Canada coach Jesse Marsch was shown a direct red card during early in the second half of his team's 2-1 Concacaf Nations League third-place match win over the United States on Sunday.

title: Hurley: UConn's historic run ends with 'honor'
content: UConn coach Dan Hurley said there was "some honor" in the end to UConn's 13-game tournament win streak, which was halted in a narrow loss to Florida on Sunday.

title: Sources: Texas nearing deal with Xavier's Miller
content: Less than a week after appearing in the First Four of the NCAA tournament, where it lost to Xavier, Texas on Sunday informed coach Rodney Terry that he has been fired, with athletic director Chris Del Conte later saying the decision was "very difficult."

title: S.C. uses Indiana's remarks as 'extra motivation'
content: South Carolina used Indiana's pregame remarks as 'extra motivation' in Sunday's 64-53 win in the second round of the NCAA tournament.

title: 'Unbelievable' Badgers win women's hockey title
content: Kirsten Simms scored on a penalty shot to tie it with 18 seconds left and then delivered the winner 2:49 into overtime, rallying the No. 1 seed Badgers to a 4-3 victory over No. 2 Ohio State in the championship match of the women's Frozen Four on Sunday.

title: Ex-Yankees OF Gardner's son, Miller, dies at 14
content: Miller Gardner, the 14-year-old son of Brett Gardner, has died, the former Yankees outfielder and his wife, Jessica, announced Sunday.

title: From 1 to 32: Ranking every team left in women’s March Madness
content: Which 1-seed got passed by UConn? UCLA or South Carolina for No. 1 overall? We rank the 32 teams that advanced.

title: Loss to Canada closes out miserable window for Pochettino's USMNT
content: The USMNT defense looked helpless in Sunday's Concacaf Nations League defeat to Canada. And has Christian Pulisic run out of gas?

title: Ferrari's Shanghai debacle: Explaining Hamilton, Leclerc DQs
content: Why were both Ferraris disqualified in China, and how costly could that be in F1's constructors' title fight?

title: Kyle Larson takes Homestead, gets 30th career win
content: Kyle Larson passed Alex Bowman with six laps remaining in NASCAR's Cup Series race at Homestead-Miami Speedway on Sunday, giving the Hendrick Motorsports driver the 30th win of his career at one of his best tracks.

title: What the rest of MLB can learn from the Royals' old-school rotation
content: Five guys day in and day out? Sounds like a bygone era. But it worked big-time for the Royals last year.

title: Refereeing error helps Chelsea claim dramatic win at Man City
content: Chelsea took another big step towards the WSL title with a last-gasp 2-1 victory over Manchester City at the Etihad. And they will be thanking the referee.

title: Juventus sack Motta, hire Tudor after heavy losses
content: Juventus have sacked manager Thiago Motta and appointed Igor Tudor, the Serie A club said on Sunday, following two consecutive heavy defeats.

title: Madrid beat Barça in women's Clásico for 1st time
content: Real Madrid beat Barcelona 3-1 at the Olympic Stadium on Sunday to secure their first-ever Clásico win and keep alive their faint title hopes.

title: Poch: USMNT faces test of 'character' vs. Canada
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said that Sunday's third-place game in the Concacaf Nations League against Canada is a match where "we need to show character."

title: Henderson: Hired a van to watch England at Euros
content: Jordan Henderson has revealed that he drove to Germany in a van to watch England at last summer's European Championship final after missing out on a call-up.

title: Ronaldo: 'No problem' with Højlund's 'Siu' celeb
content: Cristiano Ronaldo said he has "no problem" with Rasmus Højlund performing his famed "Siu" celebration after scoring in Denmark's win over Portugal on Thursday.

title: City boss: Ref said sorry after error cost goal
content: Man City boss Nick Cushing said he receieved an apology from the officials after Jess Park's strike was controversially ruled out in Sunday's 2-1 defeat to Chelsea.

title: Ex-France star Ribery: Leg was nearly amputated
content: Former Bayern Munich and France winger Franck Ribery has revealed that he almost had his leg amputated towards the end of his career after surgery on his knee.

title: England's Tuchel holds talks with Foden, Rashford
content: Thomas Tuchel has held constructive discussions with Marcus Rashford and Phil Foden after criticising their minimal impact on the wings against Albania.

title: George Foreman beat time by going from humiliation to vindication
content: Boxing is full of guys who fought past their primes. What Foreman pulled off was something entirely different.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid must choose Vinicius or Rodrygo
content: Will Vinícius Júnior or Rodrygo have to leave Real Madrid this summer? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Grading MLB's City Connect uniforms: Nats' second set doesn't live up to the first
content: From the pastel Padres to the Motor City Tigers and beyond, we break down MLB's City Connect uniforms.

title: National moot court competition held in Kochi
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Tesla investor who said Elon Musk 'Not Suited' to run Twitter, now asks Tesla Board to 'fire' him
content: Tesla investor Ross Gerber has called for Elon Musk's removal as CEO, criticizing the Tesla board for negligence and the brand erosion following Musk's Twitter acquisition. Gerber, with substantial Tesla shares, believes Musk's divided attention harms Tesla and argues for a dedicated CEO to refocus on the core business.

title: 'Close all Zerodha accounts ...': Customer message that got CEO into action
content: Sachin Jha was compelled to close his Zerodha account due to a compliance issue when his wife joined a global investment bank. Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath responded promptly, addressing the trust gap with an action plan, although Jha ultimately closed his account.

title: With Tamil Nadu people over delimitation, says Akhilesh; RJD backs exercise
content: The India bloc in Hindi-speaking states appears divided over the central government's proposed delimitation exercise. While Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav supports Tamil Nadu's stance, RJD in Bihar supports the exercise, and BSP remains non-committal. JMM aligns with the Tamil Nadu CM, expressing concerns over population-based delimitation.

title: With tickets, send flyers link to their rights, DGCA tells airlines
content: The DGCA has mandated Indian airlines to inform passengers about their rights when booking air tickets. This measure aims to educate passengers, particularly first-time flyers, about entitlements concerning delays, cancellations, denied boarding, and baggage issues. Airlines must provide an online passenger charter link via SMS, WhatsApp, ticket, and their website. IndiGo has begun implementing this directive.

title: Trump govt sends 'warning' letter to 10 highest-paid consulting companies
content: The Trump administration is scrutinizing federal consultancies like Booz Allen and Accenture, demanding clear reports on their government contracts and cost-cutting plans. Accenture's stock fell due to reduced US government work. The investigation aims to curb waste and spending in the $759 billion federal contract market, affecting major firms such as IBM and General Dynamics.

title: “Addicted to those big game feelings”: Brady Tkachuk reveals 4 Nations impact on his mindset for NHL playoffs
content: Brady Tkachuk, captain of the Ottawa Senators, shared insights on how the intense 4 Nations Face-Off tournament, where he played with his brother Matthew for Team USA, shaped his competitive spirit for the NHL playoffs. Tkachuk aims to bring the same high-stakes mindset to guide the Senators to success in their playoff push.

title: India imposes anti-dumping duties on five Chinese products
content: India has imposed anti-dumping duties on five products from China, including vacuum flasks and aluminium foil, to protect local industries. These duties, based on recommendations from the DGTR, will be in effect for up to five years and also apply to imports from other countries like Japan, Korea, and Malaysia.

title: Turkey crisis deepens: Erdogan's political rival jailed; protests intensify
content: Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, a major opposition figure, was arrested on corruption charges, sparking significant protests across Turkey. Supporters claim the charges are politically motivated to hinder his presidential ambitions, while the government denies interference. The events have drawn international criticism and led to economic instability.

title: Dodgers’ Doctor reveals actual reason behind Mookie Betts and Freddie Freeman's Tokyo Series exit
content: Freddie Freeman and Mookie Betts sat out the Dodgers' Opening Day in the Tokyo Series due to health concerns, particularly dehydration risks. Team doctor Neal ElAttrache emphasized the importance of caution to prevent long-term injuries. Betts reflected on his professional growth and future plans beyond baseball.

title: Zelenskyy says must 'push Putin' to stop strikes, halt invasion
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called for increased international pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin to end the ongoing invasion. Amid US-Ukrainian ceasefire discussions in Saudi Arabia, Zelenskyy emphasised that without global pressure, Russia would continue to prolong the conflict and ignore diplomacy. Negotiations are focused on a potential ceasefire in the Black Sea, but Putin has only agreed to halt strikes on energy infrastructure.

title: Canada PM calls snap elections for April 28, says Trump 'trying to break us'
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has called a snap election for 28 April, seeking a strong mandate. Carney plans to support farmers, address US trade tensions, and expand dental care. This follows Justin Trudeau's resignation, who faced criticism over living costs and political instability after leading since 2015.

title: IPL 2025: Noor Ahmad's dream debut helps CSK outclass MI
content: Afghanistan's Noor Ahmad made a stellar debut for CSK, taking a four-wicket haul to lead his team to a win over MI in their IPL 2025 opener. His performance restricted MI to 155/9, with Ahmad outshining with 4 for 18. Rachin Ravindra’s unbeaten 65 ensured CSK’s chase was successful, sealing victory in 19.1 overs.

title: Instant Scholar: Stephen Hawking’s PhD thesis on 'Properties of Expanding Universes'
content: Stephen Hawking's 1966 PhD thesis, Properties of Expanding Universes, laid the groundwork for his renowned contributions to cosmology and black holes. It explored singularities, the role of general relativity, and how the universe expands. His work provided vital theoretical support for the Big Bang model.

title: Kejriwal returns swinging, calls BJP 'worse than British', hits out at Cong
content: Arvind Kejriwal criticizes both BJP and Congress for neglecting Bhagat Singh and BR Ambedkar’s legacies, alleging collusion between the two parties. At a rally, he highlights BJP's removal of iconic pictures and Congress's silence, labeling BJP’s actions worse than British colonial rule.

title: 'Nitish Kumar mentally unfit, impossible PM is unaware': Prashant Kishor's big charge
content: Activist Prashant Kishor has questioned Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's mental fitness, demanding his resignation and claiming he is unaware of state affairs. Kishor's comments have intensified criticism ahead of the upcoming elections, despite reassurances from Kumar's allies about his health.

title: When Abhishek Bachchan gave fitting reply to those who call Aishwarya 'plastic'
content: Aishwarya Rai, labeled as "one of the most beautiful women in the world," has faced criticism for her acting. Her husband Abhishek Bachchan defended her, highlighting her diverse roles. Aishwarya’s illustrious career includes winning the Padma Shri and Order of Arts and Letters. Rumors of marriage troubles circulate as they appeared separately at a wedding.

title: Watch: Vintage Dhoni rolls back the years to dismiss SKY
content: MS Dhoni, at 43, performed a quick stumping to dismiss Mumbai Indians’ captain Suryakumar Yadav in the 11th over. His exceptional reflexes and skillful wicketkeeping were the highlight of the match, contributing to Chennai Super Kings' pressure on Mumbai Indians. This moment showcased Dhoni's enduring prowess and impacted Mumbai Indians' innings significantly.

title: Rohit Sharma equals unwanted IPL record with duck against CSK
content: Rohit Sharma became the second-most capped player in IPL history in Mumbai Indians' season opener against Chennai Super Kings. He also equalled the record for the most ducks in the tournament's history with his 18th duck. Despite this, it was a significant achievement in his IPL journey, which started in 2008 and includes five IPL titles with Mumbai Indians.

title: Carrasco earns major league contract with Yankees after spring training
content: Carlos Carrasco has signed a one-year, $1.5 million deal with the New York Yankees after an impressive spring training. His 1.69 ERA over five games caught the team's attention. With injury concerns in the Yankees' pitching staff, Carrasco's experience is seen as pivotal. The Yankees hope his strong spring performance continues into the regular season.

title: IPL: Kishan becomes SRH's newest hero in record IPL onslaught
content: Ishan Kishan smashed his maiden IPL century for Sunrisers Hyderabad in just 45 balls against Rajasthan Royals, leading the team to a formidable 286/6. His explosive performance included a brutal onslaught on Jofra Archer's bowling, setting up an 85-run partnership with Travis Head and ensuring a comfortable victory for SRH.

title: ‘Drop location’ method that poses severe challenges to enforcement against narcotics gaining popularity among peddlers in Bengaluru

title: BBMP appeals for support to recover tax dues, amidst opposition criticism
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Honey-trapping episode part of efforts in Congress to grab CM’s seat from Siddaramaiah, says Vijayendra

title: Man, son drown in Periyar
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Sena Workers Ransack Hotel Where Comedian Made A Jibe At Eknath Shinde
content: Shiv Sena workers have ransacked the office of "The Unicontinental Mumbai" - the site of the show during which stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra had mocked Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

title: Canada PM Calls Snap Election Amid Trade War, Trump's Annexation Threats
content: Canada's new Prime Minister, Mark Carney, who took over after Justin Trudeau's ouster, has called for snap election in the country on April 28.

title: Meerut Woman Changed Husband's Prescription To Drug Him Before Murder
content: Muskaan Rastogi had tampered with her husband's prescription to purchase sleeping pills to drug him before killing him, investigating officials on Sunday said in the Meerut murder case.

title: "Yeshu Yeshu Prophet" Seen Hitting Man, Woman In Shocking CCTV Footage
content: Weeks after Punjab Police registered a sexual harassment case against self-styled pastor Bajinder Singh, a chilling video of him assaulting a man and a woman in his office has emerged

title: Did Shivaji Have A Dog? Call To Remove Dog Memorial From Raigad Fort
content: Former Rajya Sabha member and a descendant of the Kolhapur royal family, Sambhajiraje Chhatrapati, has asked Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to remove the memorial of a dog from Raigad Fort.

title: 'Will Invite IndiGo Staff For Dinner And...': Harsha Bhogle's Dig At Airline
content: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday took a swipe at IndiGo over what he claimed was the airline's "passenger last" and "rude" attitude.

title: Encounter In J&K After Soldiers Intercept Fresh Infiltrators, Girl Injured
content: A gun battle has erupted in Kathua in Jammu and Kashmir. The encounter started after security forces intercepted a fresh group of infiltrators.

title: IPL 2025: CSK Register Easy 4-Wicket Win As MI Continue Unwanted Streak
content: Chennai Super Kings vs Mumbai Indians Highlights, IPL 2025: Rachin Ravindra played the anchor as CSK registered an easy four-wicket win over MI.

title: Trump Supporter's Immigrant Wife Arrested, Says He Does Not Regret His Vote
content: A Wisconsin man who voted for President Donald Trump says he does not regret his decision, even after federal immigration authorities arrested his wife upon their return from their honeymoon.

title: Dhoni Magic Lights Up IPL 2025, Stuns Everyone With Brilliant Stumping - Video
content: MS Dhoni left everyone stunned with a brilliant stumping to dismiss Suryakumar Yadav during the IPL 2025 encounter between Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians.

title: 'Heavy Rush' At Delhi Railway Station But 'No Stampede': Officials
content: Heavy passenger congestion due to delay in the departure of multiple trains led to chaos at the New Delhi Railway Station on Sunday but there was "no stampede" or "stampede-like" situation, Railway officials said.

title: Mumbai Cops' Actions In Sushant Singh Case Raised 'Suspicion': Ex-Bihar DGP
content: After the CBI reportedly filed a closure report on actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death case, former Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey criticized the Mumbai Police's handling of the case.

title: Woman Found Hanging With Hands Tied Behind Back In UP: Police
content: A 20-year-old woman was found hanging from a tree, her hands tied behind her back, in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia on Sunday.

title: Road to the men's Frozen Four: Complete schedule, teams at a glance
content: the 2025 men's hockey tournament is set, with the 16-team bracket in place . all games will air on the ESPN networks and stream on ESPN+ . the winners of the six conference tournaments win automatic NCAA berths .

content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Top free agent Stefon Diggs visits New England: Could it be a good fit?
content: the Patriots traded for veteran receiver Randy Moss in 2007 . some wondered how he would fit into the team's culture . the story comes to mind in the wake of a visit to a free agent last week . diggs is an equal to Moss as a player .

title: KMC opens special counters to pay taxes
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: UPS rules: Central government employees take note!
content: UPS guidelines: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has introduced guidelines for the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), effective April 1, 2025. This scheme offers central government employees currently enrolled in the National Pension Scheme (NPS) a comprehensive alternative.

title: Watch: Self-styled prophet Bajinder Singh assaults woman in office
content: CCTV footage reveals controversial preacher Bajinder Singh assaulting individuals, including a woman with a child, sparking outrage. Singh is also under investigation for sexual harassment following a complaint by a 22-year-old. Despite his significant social media following, Singh's history of legal issues raises serious concerns.

title: Lewis Hamilton and Charles Leclerc disqualified from Chinese GP
content: Charles Leclerc, Lewis Hamilton, and Pierre Gasly were disqualified from the Chinese Grand Prix due to technical infringements. Leclerc's and Gasly's cars were underweight, and Hamilton's car had excessive skid block wear. This led to a significant reordering of race results, impacting Ferrari's and Alpine's standings in the 2025 F1 season.

title: Rohit hits another milestone before taking field in IPL 2025
content: Rohit Sharma has achieved the distinction of becoming the second-most capped player in IPL history with his 258th match appearance. He surpassed Dinesh Karthik and now only trails MS Dhoni. Rohit's IPL journey has been marked by his significant contributions both as a batsman and leader, helping Mumbai Indians secure five IPL titles.

title: Akhilesh Yadav defends Ramjilal Suman's 'Rana Sanga traitor' remark
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav defended MP Ramjilal Suman's remark calling Rana Sanga a "traitor," arguing that referencing historical events should not be problematic. Suman had made the comment while criticizing BJP's labeling of Muslims as Babur's descendants. This has sparked controversy with BJP accusing SP of insulting the Rajput and Hindu communities.

title: More than 400 Hollywood celebrities send complaint letter against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, have signed an open letter to the Trump administration opposing efforts to weaken copyright protections for AI training. They argue such changes would harm the creative industry, which supports millions of American jobs and significant economic contributions.

title: Record! SRH score second highest IPL total; Kishan slams ton
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad set an imposing total of 286/6 against Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2025, nearly breaking their own record. The innings was highlighted by Ishan Kishan's unbeaten 106 off 47 balls. Supported by key contributions from Travis Head and others, SRH's relentless batting continues to dominate, underscoring their formidable prowess in the league.

title: Meerut murder case: Muskan Rastogi seeks govt defense counsel as family cuts ties
content: Muskan Rastogi, accused of murdering her husband with her lover, seeks a government-appointed lawyer after her family withdrew support. The couple, struggling in jail, exhibit signs of drug withdrawal. Deceived by messages after the crime, the murder was revealed on March 18. Muskan's family demands the death penalty.

title: Pressure on Gill? Phillips says 'you don't get more pressure than playing for India'
content: Captain Shubman Gill faces high expectations in IPL 2025 after a disappointing 2024 season for Gujarat Titans. Glenn Phillips emphasises that team performance isn't solely about the captain, noting Gill's experience with high-pressure situations for India. Phillips and his brother, Dale, are renowned for their exceptional fielding skills, attributed to genetics and dedicated practice.

title: Ishan Kishan Scripts History, Achieves Never-Done-Before IPL Feat For SRH
content: Ishan Kishan left everyone stunned with his sensational batting display as the ignored Indian cricket team batter slammed a 45-ball century for Sunrisers Hyderabad during the IPL 2025 match against Rajasthan Royals.

title: Hindi Was Compulsory 3rd Language During Congress Rule: BJP To DMK
content: BJP Tamil Nadu president K Annamalai on Sunday claimed Hindi was the 'compulsory' third language during the Congress-led UPA regime and asserted it was Prime Minister Narendra Modi who gave the option of studying any Indian language as a 3rd language

content: our betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at the sports betting stories that are driving the conversation . the first game of Sunday's men's March Madness slate produced arguably the biggest thriller of the tournament thus far . Florida outlasted UConn 77-75, ending the Huskies' bid at the first national championship .

title: NCAA title test: Which women's icons got it done -- and is Paige Bueckers next?
content: Paige Bueckers is the ultimate stage for college basketball stars to cement legacies . women's players must either graduate or turn 22 before heading to the WNBA . despite the setbacks, she reached 2,000 career points in the fewest games in program history .

title: Why Micah Parsons isn't the only player Dallas needs to extend this offseason
content: three key members of the Cowboys' 2022 draft class are in position to sign extensions . first-rounder Tyler Smith has his fifth-year option for 2026 at a cost of $21.27 million . the 49ers will look different in 2025 .

title: All-Star to architect: Buster Posey's plan to rebuild the Giants
content: buster Posey is six days shy of his 38th birthday and less than six months removed from a job few people of his stature have ever taken on . he has a different role: to methodically guide them there, inch by inch, meeting by meeting, transaction by transaction . "as a player, I would come in every day and have a list in my mind of what I wanted to accomplish," he says .

title: Mount St. Mary's HC Donny Lind and son reflect on tourney run
content: mount St. Mary's Mountaineers coach Donny Lind has had his son, Silas, with him for much of this season . the elder says he's enjoyed missing school, playing with his friends on the court . "it's been a blast to be able to bring him with me," he says .

title: Women's NCAA tournament live tracker: Highlights and analysis from Day 3
content: we're down to 32 teams in the 2025 women's tournament as the second round tips off Sunday . for the first time, six teams topped 100 points in the first round, and five teams won by more than 50 points . the round of 32 includes just two double-digit seeds .
